dialogues.text: Mrs. Little sticks a pretty little sign on Margalo's jewelry box which say, "Margalo's Place." In a RAPID SERIES OF SHOTS the box becomes more and more furnished and homey and pretty -- a little rug, some bird toys, a swing, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Little completes work on a new birdbath. They watch as Margalo tries it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family is playing "Clue" and enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: MANTEL
dialogues.text: A new family picture is placed on the mantel. It includes Mr. and Mrs. Little, George, Stuart, Snowbell, and Margal seated on Snowbell's head. Margalo stares at it. She seems to have mixed reactions.

dialogues.speaker: SMALL DINNER TABLE
dialogues.text: Now Margalo is juggling peas for Stuart. She serves them to him, then looks up for one pea she hasn't accounted for. Then, once again, the last pea lands with a squish on Stuart's head. Margalo and Stuart both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY MUSICALE
dialogues.text: The song ends with Margalo flying up on to the bust of Beethoven and joining in with a fancy trill delighting th Littles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margalo is treating herself to a bath and reprising the song she sang with the family. She is alone. She turns and is startled by the sight of Falcon perched on the edg of the birdbath. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Isn't this delightful? Singing in the shower. Do you need anything? A sponge, some shampoo?

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (nervously) I was just...

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Yeah, you were just. Never con a con man. What's going on? I'm growing old waiting for that ring.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinking... What if we... just forget the job?

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: It's just that... it's too hard. Like I said, she never takes the ring off. Give me another job and I promise I'll make it up to you. Falcon flies to the window sill. Looking in, he can see the mantel and the new family picture.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: You think I don't know what's going on? I've been watching you. You're starting to ‘like’ these people. Especially that mouse. She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Margalo, what did I teach you? First lesson.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (mumbles ) Never care about the mark.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: I didn't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (louder) Never care about the mark. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: That's right. The mark is your victim. And when you care about them, you become the mark! You become the victim.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: It's not like that! You don't understand because you never had a friend. Just people who were afraid of you.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: That's right. Friendship comes and goes. Fear is permanent. And profitable. I'11 prove it to you.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Yeah, how?

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Get me that ring -- by tonight!-- or I'll kill the mouse.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: You -- !

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: See what I mean? Fear. The only friend I need. By tonight. Don't forget. He flies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Little finishes doing the dishes. She turns away from the sink with wet hands and finds a dish towel. She wipes her hands thoroughly, then turns back to the sink. She reaches for the ring stand. The ring is not on it. Confused, she looks at her finger, then back at the stand then all around the area, gradually becoming more panicky

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: What -- I -- Frederick! George! Stuart! One-by-one, Mr. Little, George and Stuart rush in to the kitchen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mrs. Little is very upset and is turning over everything in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: My ring! My wedding ring! It's gone!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Where did you have it last?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: On the ring stand. I took it off to do the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Yes... No... Yes. I don't know, I'm too upset. If I didn't take it off... She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: It could've gone down the drain. He gasps exactly as she did.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I'll call a plumber. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I can do it. Let me go, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Down the drain. If it's there, I can bring it back up. It's an adventure.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I don't know, Stuart. It's awfully dark down there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And smelly. And cold.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: But... it's Mom's ring. Come on, Dad, let me try. Mr. Little thinks about it. He's torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Little removing a small pocket flashlight from his ke chain. He hands it to Stuart who is dressed in his yellow rain suit and hat. He is ready for the descent. He climbs onto a fishing hook attached to a string, waves bravely, and is lowered into the chain.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: If it gets too cold or too frightening you just tell us. Or yank on the string and we'll pull you right up.

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Will do.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: How is it so far?

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wet. Looking up from STUART'S POV, we can see glimpses of his father's eyes looking down at him and occasional views of the kitchen ceiling growing further and further away. It is like he is viewing the world from the wrong end of a telescope.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: There's a lot of slimy stuff on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What does it look like?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Stuart looks around. It's wet and slimy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Like the inside of your nose. A look of revulsion flashes across George's face.

dialogues.speaker: STRING
dialogues.text: It is fraying as Stuart descends but no one notices.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Do you see the bottom yet?

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No! Just more pipe. And everything we ate for dinner last week. The pipe just seems to go on_and on and -- (falling) ooooon... The string has broken. Mr. Little pulls it. The loose end comes rising out of the drain without Stuart. Mrs. Little returns.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: The plumber said he -- what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Well... we have a little problem... someone you and I love just, sort of... went down the drain.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Stuart?!!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Good guess, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: What's he doing down there?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: We... sent him down to look for the ring.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: You sent our son down the kitchen drain?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Well -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Would you send Martha up the chimney? Or George down the toilet? I don't think so!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Eleanor, you're being a little...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: A little what?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Let's just concentrate on helping Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Stuart!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (yells into the drain) Are you all right, Stuart? Can you hear me? We hear Stuart SPLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm okay. SPITTING noises. Panicking,

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I'm lowering more string. Can you see it? Can you grab it?

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I_can't reach it. It's not long enough.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Get more string! they all comb through all the kitchen drawers looking for more string, flinging things everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margalo is perched outside the kitchen window, watching and listening to the action inside. She checks under her wing where she has Mrs. Little's ring. THROUGH the window: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: There is no more.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Well, what else can we use as string?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Spaghetti?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Hang on, Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant, Margalo flies in the window and over to Mrs. Little, and, before anyone realizes what has happened, she unlatches her pearl necklace and lowers it into the drain. Mrs. Little stares at her with shock and admiration.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Why didn't I think of that? Stuart calls out.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I_got it. Margalo quickly takes to the air, raising the necklace with Stuart holding on to it, and bringing him to safety. He emerges from the drain empty-handed but to the cheers of his entire family. Mrs. Little grabs her little boy and presses him to her cheek. You've never seen so much love.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Oh, Stuart. To think I could have lost you for a stupid ring.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: It wasn't down there, Mom. Then she reaches out to Margalo, lifts her up, and kisses the top of her head.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: What a wonderful little bird. This family owes you so much. Margalo stands there with what seems like a guilty look o her face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Margalo, you're the best friend I ever had. Margalo looks down, as if embarrassed by Stuart's declaration. This is all too much for George. He takes one whiff of his brother and takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yuck, you stink. Everyone but Margalo laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margalo listens to an O.S. ARGUMENT coming from the maste bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: What if someone had accidentally turned on the garbage disposal while he was down there? What about that?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I would not have let that happen.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: You let him go down the drain.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Eleanor, I love him just as much as you do. I'm just not quite as...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (defensively) Emotional? Hysterical? What were you going to say, Frederick?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I... forget.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (calmer) Oh, Frederick, I know I'm being... overprotective I just can't stand the idea of Stuart getting hurt.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Margalo pushes it open a crack and flies up to Stuart's bunk. He is asleep. She lands beside him and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart. I need to talk. There's something I need to tell you. He is sound asleep and doesn't hear her. After a moment she quietly turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margalo is wearing her helmet and goggles. She steps outside. She hesitates for a moment and we see tears forming in her eyes. Then she spreads her wings, takes a step, and flies off into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ALARM GOES OFF. Stuart wakes up. Margalo's stickpin is on his pillow. He reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart is climbing up into his chair at the breakfast table. We see a PLUMBER's legs sticking out under the sink. The Plumber slides out.

dialogues.speaker: PLUMBER
dialogues.text: You people sure like your meatloaf.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Yes, we do. Did you find the ring?

dialogues.speaker: PLUMBER
dialogues.text: Everything but. The Littles accept this news bravely.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Hey, where's Margalo?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Probably still asleep. Stuart jumps out of his chair.  42 43 44 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Littles are standing over it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Maybe she just went out for a walk or a little flight around the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Sure, you know... to strengthen her wing.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Yeah... maybe. But why did she leave me her pin? They can't answer.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I'm sure she wouldn't leave without saying good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: She'll probably be back before you get home from school. Stuart looks unconvinced. The Plumber enters.

dialogues.speaker: PLUMBER
dialogues.text: While you're all upset anyway, here's my bill. He exits. Stuart stares at Margalo's empty bed.

dialogues.speaker: LATER 42
dialogues.text: 43 44 45 George is sleeping. Something disturbs his sleep. He wakes up and sees Stuart packing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What are you doing? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I couldn't sleep. I think I know what happened. I think the Falcon got her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (impressed) Yeah?!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm going to find her. And don't try to talk me out of it, because I've made up my mind.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? You can't go out there.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: You mean because I'm too small? Listen, George, you're as big as you feel.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: But... all right, then, but let me come with you.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: No. I need you to stay here and cover for me.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Cover for you? How?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Tell Mom and Dad that I... had to leave early for school.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What if they ask why?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Well, make something up. You're smart.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Stuart... she's just a bird.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: No, George, she's family. And she's my friend. And when you're friends with Stuart Little you're friends for life. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Well if you won't let me come at least get somebody to go with you.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: That's a good idea, but who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowbell is asleep on his back, legs spread. He makes little noises in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (whispers) Snow... Snowbell! Snowbell wakes up, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (rapidly) The good silverware's in the dining room, take whatever you want but don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: It's me Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Oh... This better be important.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Margalo's still missing.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: I should've been more specific. I meant important to me.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm going out to look for her. I was hoping you'd come with me.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Well, because we're friends... and because I'd do the same for you... and because if you don't and the Littles ask where I've gone, George is going to tell them you ate me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: What?! Why you little -- Ooh! You know something... everybody thinks you're so nice. You're not so nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart is driving. Snowbell jogs alongside.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Slow down. The most exercise I get is circling my cat box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Little is at the kitchen table feeding Martha.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Say 'Mama'... 'Dada'... Say anything...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs. George enters.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Where's Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... he already left.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: He did? Why?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... he had to get to school early so he could, uh... (an idea) Because he's in the school play!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (pleased) Really?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes. He... plays a mouse. And they rehearse in the morning before school. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Why didn't he tell me?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He... forgot. You know because of being worried about Margalo.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Right. Well, good, this will take his mind off it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Gotta go. George runs out.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (to Martha) Say ‘oatmeal'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart and Snowbell are standing next to Stuart's car. Smoke is coming out from underneath the hood.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: This looks like me after I found that burrito. Well, we gave it our best shot. Let's go home. Race you for the warm spot under the window. Go. Stuart pushes the car against the building and begins to walk.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: We're not giving up.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (cajoling) Oh, why not? Giving up is fun. And look at all the time you save. I'm telling you, Stuart, if more people gave up there'd be fewer wars. A pair of squirrels rush by.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Excuse me. We're looking for a bird that may live around here. A Falcon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The SQUIRRELS SCREECH and run away.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Well, that was encouraging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George returns home from school. Mrs. Little is there.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Hi. Where's Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (surprised) You mean he's not...? (improvising) Oh! Oh! I just remembered. He told me to tell you that he's rehearsing again. At Will's house. And... he might even have to sleep over.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Sleep over? On a school night?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hey. That's what he said. Gotta go. George runs out. Mr. Little enters.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Boys home?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: George is but Stuart is rehearsing a play. And then he's staying over at Will's house tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: On a school night?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Well... I thought it would give him room to grow. Mr. Little nods his head and smiles at his wife. He's very proud.  50 51 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart and Snowbell are in a seedier part of town. Stuart sees a leaky faucet. He pulls a towel out of his knapsack and washes his hands and face. Then he pulls out some raisins and begins to eat. Snowbell is not happy.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: I see you remembered to take care of your needs. What about my needs.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Would you like some raisins?

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (contemptuously) Cats don't eat raisins! We have too much class. We eat fish by- products. Also, I... need to go tinky.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: How about the alley.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: An alley? I'ma cat! We're fastidious creatures. We use a litter box. We don't just yell ‘Bombs away’ and go wherever we are! Look, face it, we're never going to find her.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: If we only knew somebody who really knew the streets. Who knew the disgusting underbelly of life in the Big City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we realize what is happening, the back door opens, and a big black cat is sent hurling into the alley. It is MONTE.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: You stay out of my kitchen. You come back again and I serve you for dinner. The Man returns to his restaurant and slams the door. Monte raises his fist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Don't you threaten me! What I could tell the health inspector would close you down in a New York minute! Monte quickly regains his composure, wipes himself off, and is about to wander away when Snowbell calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Hi, Monte. Monte sees Snowbell.

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Monte, we need your help.

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: (to Snowbell, re: Stuart) Hey -- are you still friends with him or can I eat him?

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: No, you can't eat him.

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Pleeease!

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: No. Now pay attention. What do you know about a bird called Falcon?

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Falcon! Oh, that's a bad guy. You don't want to fool with him.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Where can we find him?

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Find him? You don't want to find him. You don't want anything to do with him. Trust me. He'd eat you so fast you'd be a pile of Falcon poop before you could yell for help. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MONTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Snowbell) Falcons eat cats too, you know. They grab you by the neck and carry you so high you can't even see the ground. And then they drop ya. By the time you hit the pavement, they just drink what's left through a straw. Snowbell is frozen in terror. Snowbell gulps.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Snowbell, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (nervously) Yeah. In fact, good news. I no longer need a litter box.

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Mop up on aisle three.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Stu, listen. This whole thing has been a groove and a gas, but it's important to know when the fun's over. You don't want to be that last pathetic person who leaves a party.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I told you. We're not giving up.

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Well... if you gotta find him, he lives at the top of the Pishkin Building. Across the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA TILTS DOWN FROM the towering heights of the building with its silver art deco pinnacle and massive falcon gargoyles projecting out from each corner of its uppermost floor. Stuart and Snowbell are across the street in a cafe, looking up. They are dwarfed by the immensity of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart and Snowbell are walking around the tables in an outdoor cafe across the street from the building. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Snowbell keeps being attracted to bits of food on the ground but Stuart admonishes him.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Snowbell, how can you think of food at a time like this? Stay on track, will you? (suddenly points) Look! Stuart and Snowbell zero in on a cellular phone sticking up out of a woman's purse sitting beside her chair. Stuart rushes to it. He climbs up the side of the purse and tumbles into it, landing alongside a packet of Kleene tissues, a set of keys, a box of Altoids, a pile of loose change, and the phone. He turns it on and dials. Suddenly we hear George on the other end and CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN them.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hello, Little residence.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (whispering) Oh, George, I'm glad you answered.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Who is it? Can you speak louder, please?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (raising his voice a bit) George, it's me, Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Stuart! (then lowering his voice quickly) Stuart. Where are you? How are you? Did you find her? Are you all right? How's Snowbell? When are you coming home? Mom and Dad are asking lots of questions.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: So are you. Look, I only have a second. I just want you to know that I found her, I'm going off to get her right now, and with any luck, we'll be home by four o'clock. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: But where are you?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: We're at the Pishkin -- At that instant a WOMAN's hand reaches into the purse and pulls out Stuart along with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I'll just call my husband and -- She sees Stuart clinging to the phone and screams.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: A mouse! There's a mouse using my phone!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: It's all right, calm down. It was a credit card call. She begins screaming at the top of her lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is standing next to the living room phone with his school bag still on his back.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Stuart? Stuart? Are you still there? Suddenly Mrs. Little appears carrying Martha.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: George, is that Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (quickly hanging up) Uh... let me think. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Well, where is he? I thought he was coming home.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Uh, he is. Later. He and Will needed to rehearse some more. In fact, I just left them at Will's. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK at the door. Mrs. Little goes to answer it. Will is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Little, is George here?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: will? George turns white and dashes into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Will! I found it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Found what?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The... calculator.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: The cal...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (pulling him) It's in my bedroom. Come on, I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Will, where's Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It's okay, she knows about the play. (to Mrs. Little) They wanted it to be a surprise. (to Will) I had to tell her. So she knows Stuart is at your house, and we're going right back over there.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (gets it) Oh, yeah. Right. It's going to be great. I just needed to get the... calculator?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: To figure out how long they should rehearse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It's a very complicated play.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Come on, it's on my desk.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: See you later, Mrs. Little. The two boys quickly run up the stairs to George's room. Mrs. Little stands there with her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: George, remember, you and Stuart have a soccer game later.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We'll meet you there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and George are walking over to Will's house.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I can't handle this. I'm too stressed. All this lying. I've never lied before.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: That's why she believes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart and Snowbell are standing outside the Pishkin Building wondering what to do.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: What are you planning to do, Spiderman, scale the wall?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'll think of something. Stuart stands there silently for a moment and then notice a balloon man selling balloons across the street. His eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Will are playing Battleship when Will's brothe DAREN, 14, comes into the bedroom carrying a portable phone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAREN
dialogues.text: George, it's your mother.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: My mother? Oh, no. What did you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: DAREN
dialogues.text: Tell her? I said, ‘Just a minute, I'1l get him.' He hands George the phone. George takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Mom? What's up? Stuart? Well actually, he's... taking a nap ‘cause, they've been working so hard on... the big dance number. If you want I can put the phone by his mouth and you can listen to him breathe. He holds it up to Will who makes little mousey snores.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll have him call you as soon as he wakes up... I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (mousey voice) I love you, too. George hits him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No, that was Will's brother. ‘Bye. (hangs up and turns to Will) Now what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go look for him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Where? All he told me was he was at a wall.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: A wall? What kind of wall? There must be a million walls in New York. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Boy, are we in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, ‘'we.' He didn't spend the night rehearsing at my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helium-filled balloon rising up alongside the Pishkin Building. A Coke can is suspended beneath it like a makeshift gondola. Stuart is standing inside it, slowly dribbling out handfuls of sand to lighten the load. He looks down at Snowbell who is waving at him as Stuart rises higher and higher up the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart rising even higher up the side of the building. The balloon is being buffeted by winds. He is almost at the top. He sees the falcon gargoyles just above him. And then he is there. With perfect timing he steps out of the gondola onto the terrace surrounding the pinnacle of the building. It is strangely empty and unguarded. Clearly not many people arrive this way. Cautiously, Stuart reaches into his knapsack and pulls ou a bow made out of a paper clip and rubber band, and a pin cushion full of arrows. He begins stalking through the large space crouched like a policeman with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (quietly) Margalo? Margalo? Are you up here? Is anybody here? Stuart sees a large, frightening-looking bird shadow on the wall. He gasps in fear, then turns to face the danger. Only it turns out to be Margalo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Margalo! Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart! What -- ? Stuart, you've got to get out of here! Falcon is!--

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: That's what I figured. That's why I'm here. I came to rescue you.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (touched) Rescue me?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Of course!

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: So you don't know about...

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: About what? Come on, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart... I can't go.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Sure, you can.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Oh, Stuart... there's something you don't understand. I... They hear:

dialogues.speaker: FALCON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Maybe I can explain. They look over and see Falcon who beckons.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Let me show you something. Stuart hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Afraid?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: No! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart, don't!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: It's all right. Stuart follows Falcon into Falcon's lair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is stolen merchandise -- jewels, rings, pins, etc.!-- in old paint cans. Falcon enters with Stuart and Margalo behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Please, Falcon --

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: My treasures. All the things in here... are stolen... many of them by Margalo. (points) This one... and this one... (holds up Mrs. Little's ring) And this special one.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: My mom's ring! How -- ?

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Try to follow along. She just pretended to be hurt, so you'd take her in. That's what she does. ‘Oh, maybe if I had a place to sleep. A little jewelry box perhaps.' Sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (to Margalo) You...?

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Margalo works for me. In fact, she does anything I tell her to do... or else.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I see... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Margalo is ashamed.
61 Aw, look at him... his little mouse heart is broken. By the way... if you've ever had mouse heart... it's delicious.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Falcon, don't. Falcon walks towards Stuart. Stuart

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (aims his bow) raises the bow. All right, birdbrain, give me back that ring... because my friend and I are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Friend?

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Friend?!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: That's right. Friend. He looks at Margalo. She smiles. Stuart smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: (to Stuart) Good-bye... 'friend."

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: No! Stuart fires a pin from his bow. It Falcon turns sideways and catches it he spits it back at Stuart. The pin collar and pins him to the wall, his pathetically off the ground. Falcon

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: travels truly but in his mouth. Then catches Stuart's feet dangling keeps coming at him. I hope I wasn't out of line with that 'birdbrain' remark. Falcon pulls out the pin. Stuart drops to the floor. Falcon towers over him, spreads his wings and screeches a he shows his claws.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Falcon, no!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Falcon picks Stuart up in his talons and flies him over the edge of the building. He holds him for a beat... then drops him.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart! She goes to help him, but Falcon intercepts her violently and carries her SQUAWKING into an old, small, battered birdcage. He throws her inside and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: You didn't have to kill him!

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: I didn't. The sidewalk's gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: STUART FALLING
dialogues.text: Stuart, screaming, is tumbling rapidly. He gets an idea. He pulls off his backpack and empties it. Then clutching it by the backstraps, he holds it over his head. The wind catches it creating a parachute effect which, at least, slows his rate of descent. It fills with air and becomes a parachute. He begins to float down. He lands in a moving garbage truck. Luckily it is a soft landing and he quickly stands up. Unfortunately, as he stands a load of garbage is dumped on him. A big metal can hits him on the head. His eyes crisscross as the world blurs before him and he topples onto a mound of garbage bags and passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart covered in coffee grinds and not sure where he is. He hears the sound of a BOAT WHISTLE and grabs his throbbing head. Quickly he climbs to the top of a mound of garbage bags and gasps. He is on a garbage barge pulling away from a Manhattan dock and heading out to sea At the far end of the barge, up a high metal wall, he see the barge CAPTAIN and his first mate piloting the boat. He scampers over a ton of rubbish and tries to call up to them.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Help! Help! This is a mistake. I'm not supposed to be here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But they are far away and he is barely a speck to them, his tiny voice drowned out by the ROAR of the ENGINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowbell is standing anxiously in front of the Pishkin Building looking lost and forlorn. He stares up at a clock and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: I'll bet something terrible has happened. What should I do? Oh, Lord, I need my belly tickled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK at Will's door. WILL'S MOTHER answers it. Mrs. Little is standing there with Martha in a stroller and two soccer uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Wilson, hi. George and Stuart left without their soccer uniforms, so I brought them over. Kids -- they'd forget their heads if they weren't attached.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WILSON, (WILL'S MOTHER)
dialogues.text: Well, George is here, but... I haven't seen Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (confused) But... he slept over here last night.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (angrily) George?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to Will) Which way is Canada?  66 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart is on the barge. He's using a broken piece of pencil to write on a dirty scrap of paper. A whiskey bottle is alongside.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Dear Mom and Dad, I am writing this letter and placing it in this whiskey bottle, so you will know what's happened to me -- your son, Stuart Little. In a few minutes I will be dumped under a ton of disgusting trash into the East River. (thinks ) No, that might upset them. Dear Mom and Dad. I've run away to join the circus. I will from now on be known as Gazombo the Mouseboy. Say good-bye to George. Give Martha a kiss for me. All my love... Gazombo. He rolls it up and starts to put it in the bottle but drops the bottle. It breaks.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Oh, I am so useless. I thought a Little is always supposed to see the silver lining... that must mean I'm not even a real Little. Behind Stuart something glints. Stuart's ears twitch. He's sensing something. Slowly, he turns. He sees the glint.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: A silver lining. He walks towards the pile of garbage from which the glint appeared. He begins tossing aside refuse, until he sees something that amazes him.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I don't believe it! (gets closer) It is! To his absolute astonishment he has found his broken airplane buried in the garbage.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: My airplane!!!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He pulls pieces of the plane out of the rubble and stares at what remains of it. It is not a pretty sight. It has broken wings, a smashed front window, a badly damaged fuselage, and the flight manual jammed inside. It's in terrible shape and there is no way it could ever fly.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: The silver lining! This is it! I am a Little! He takes a deep breath and begins scouring the barge for anything he can find. We watch Stuart consulting the flight manual and assembling a pile of strange objects, Band-Aids, Styrofoa cups and packing material, old combs, string, cardboard, Q-Tips, rubber bands, electrical wire, and lots of AAA batteries which he pulls out of old television remotes an broken electronic toys. Dowzer and Snoop fly over to watch Stuart, intrigued by his extraordinary industriousness. He hears:

dialogues.speaker: SNOOP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Dowzer, come here. Stuart peeks over a mound of garbage and sees two stupid pigeons, SNOOP and DOWZER. Snoop is looking at something we can't see.

dialogues.speaker: SNOOP
dialogues.text: Wanna see the stupidest-looking pigeon you ever saw?

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER
dialogues.text: Sure. Dowzer comes over beside Snoop.

dialogues.speaker: SNOOP
dialogues.text: Hey, look. Now there's two of them. And they both look stupid. REVEAL Snoop and Dowzer are looking in a broken old mirror. Stuart reacts to their stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Oh, brother. The pigeons spot Stuart. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER
dialogues.text: Hey. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm Stuart. (grabs plastic fork as weapon) And don't try anything.

dialogues.speaker: SNOOP
dialogues.text: Hey, you better not try anything. (indicates mirror) There's four of us.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Right. The pigeons get a look at the model airplane.

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm rebuilding a plane. I'm going to fly off this barge. Dowzer and snoop begin to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SNOOP
dialogues.text: It'd take you a year to fix that.

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER
dialogues.text: And you don't even have an hour. They're gonna dump this garbage in the river right around sunset and you and your plane along with it.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Dump it in the river? Is that legal?

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER/SNOOP
dialogues.text: (confused) Well, I... they... I...

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Hey! We're pigeons not lawyers!

dialogues.speaker: SNOOP
dialogues.text: That's telling him. They chest bump or high-five, whatever's cheaper.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Little back in the Little house. He is fuming. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Room to grow? Room to grow? What were we thinking?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I was just doing what you said.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Except I didn't say we should let him go sleep at someone's house without a toiletries bag, without pajamas, without checking to see if he was actually there.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I did check... Just not right away. Oh, Frederick how are we going to find him?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Well, we could...

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: No! Don't you speak to me. We'll deal with you later, you... not teller of the truth.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: All right, George, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (demanding) Well?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You just told me not to speak.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Where did Stuart go?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I promised I wouldn't tell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: George, there is a difference between protecting your brother and being responsible for his safety. What if he's in danger? What kind of protection is that? George, hesitates, then:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He went to rescue Margalo. He thinks the Falcon got her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: A Falcon? He went after a Falcon?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He called me. He's all right. He said he was at... the Pishkins'.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Who? Honey, do we know Pishkins?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: We know the Mishkins. And the Lumpkins. And the Pitkins... The Pishkin Building? Is that what he meant?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Let's hope so.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Dad... Am I going to get walloped?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: George, has your father ever walloped you?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: But there's always a first time. First, let's go find Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People wait for the elevator. The doors open and they crowd in. Among their feet, we see Snowbell sneak on with them. The doors close.  69 70 71 72 73 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People begin to sniff the air. Then they begin to sniff and eye each other suspiciously. We hear GRUMBLING. At the next floor everyone rushes out except Snowbell, who i left alone.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (defensively) Hey -- I'm sorry! You sleep in the street and see how you smell! The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Little family is standing right in front of Stuart's car. It's a disaster. The wheels are gone and so are the seats. It's been spray-painted.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Who would do this?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Tiny little vandals. Mr. Little steps to the curb and urgently raises his hand

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Falcon returning from some foray or other to hi lair. He arrives to find Margalo still caged and a whole platoon of pigeons pecking around for scraps. Falcon lands next to the cage.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Pigeons! Look at them! Bums. Panhandlers. Leeches. (yells) Hey! Here's an idea. Work for a living! I'll teach you a new word -- Ambition!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at him uncomprehendingly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Get out of here!! The pigeons fly away.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: (to Margalo) Well, have you thought it over? Are you coming back to work?

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: You mean come back to being a thief? No. Never.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Then rot in there. Falcon flies off. Just then, a stairway door is pushed open and Snowbell steps out.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (from cage) Snowbell1!

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Margalo! Where's Stuart? For a moment she doesn't answer. Then she hangs her head.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Oh, Snowbell, he's dead. Falcon killed him. Snowbell is shocked and grief stricken.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: What?! Stuart is dead?! No. He can't be. He's... he's my friend. Margalo begins to cry. Snowbell, deeply moved, begins to sob.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (crying) I was supposed to protect him. Oh, I wish it was me who'd been killed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (crying) Really?

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (crying) No, but I am very unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart sitting in the cockpit of the plane. He attaches the final wires to the servos and starts the engine. Nothing happens. He tries again. Nothing happens again. Dowzer and Snoop are outside laughing. Stuart goes back to the batteries and repositions them. He returns to the cockpit and tries once more. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER
dialogues.text: That's never gonna fly.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: DOWZER
dialogues.text: Hey, I know flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain of the barge.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Okay, let's dump this load. He pushes a button and the sides of the barge begin to tilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart, desperately trying to take off.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Anyone care to give me a push? Dowzer and Snoop laugh. The garbage is beginning to slide. Stuart is rapidly scanning the flight manual and beginning to panic. The tilt of the barge actually starts the plane rolling down the runway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stuart makes one more effort to start the plane, and, to everyone's amazement the ENGINE TURNS OVER. In an instant Stuart is taxiing for lift-off.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Now what? Gasping, he looks back at the manual for guidance. The birds jump out of the way and stare in astonishment as he speeds past them. Faster and faster he goes but does not leave the ground. The end of the barge is rapidly approaching. Stuart grits his teeth. The birds seem nervous too. The plane is just inches away from the end of the runway and poised to do a perfect nose dive into the sea. Snoop covers his eyes with his wings, when suddenly, at the las possible second, the plane rises into the air. The Captain looks up just in time to see Stuart fly off the barge.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: What the -- ? What have we got now? Flying garbage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart, is maintaining an even course across the city. Approaching ahead of him he sees the top of the Pishkin Building. He bites his lip.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: That miserable Falcon! From this day forward, I vow revenge. If that Falcon were here right now, I'd rip his throat out, I'd scratch his face off, I'd --

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: He's in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (frightened) He -- ?! I've got to get out of here! He starts to run. Margalo through the bars, bites his tail. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: No! He's got me! Please! Don't hurt me! Kill the bird, not me! He jerks himself free, knocking over the cage and accidentally busting it open.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Come on, let's get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: How? I can't just fly out of here. These are whiskers, not wings. I --

dialogues.speaker: FALCON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Margalo? Snowbell squeals in fright.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be Falcon poop!! He runs and jumps into a paint can. Falcon appears. He sees the broken cage and sees Margalo.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Who broke that cage? The CAN TREMBLES.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Me. Just me. There's no one else here. Falcon scans the roof until he sees Snowbell's tail sticking out of the paint car. Margalo steps in front of the can. Falcon walks over to the CAN which CONTINUES TO TREMBLE. He kicks it. It rolls to the edge of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Snowbell, get out!

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (muffled) Can't... stuck... too fat. The can teeters on the edge of the roof and stops. Then Falcon picks up a seed and spits it at the can. The can goes over the side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Snowbell, in the can, plummets. Snowbell screams -- then suddenly stops plummeting and starts to turn end-over-end rapidly. The handle of the paint can has been caught on the end of a bare horizontal flagpole and spins rapidly many times until it stops. It hangs precariously near the end of the pole.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: Could somebody please take me home now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margalo and Falcon.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: I'm leaving here, Falcon! And I'm never going to have anything to do with you again as long as I live! He moves with incredible quickness and grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: Well, then that isn't going to be very long! He raises his claws towards Margalo's throat. She closes her eyes. At that very instant the PUTT-PUTT of Stuart's PLANE can be heard. Falcon spins around as the plane shoots around from the side of the spire aiming right for Falcon's face They all seem stunned to see the other. Falcon jumps back onto the terrace. Margalo cries when she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart?!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Hang on, I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: No! Stuart! Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: (to Margalo) I'1l deal with you when I'm finished with him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Falcon flings Margalo back on to the roof knocking her unconscious. Stuart opens the bomb bay doors and rusty bolts rain down on Falcon. Falcon rises into the air. He spreads his wings, SCREECHES, his eyes turn red, and his talons actually glisten. He fills the entire window of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: You're mine now, you little rodent. Stuart gasps and grabs for the servo. Suddenly the plane does a flip/flop backwards somersault and tumbles rapidly toward the traffic below. It is an unexpected maneuver and takes both Falcon and Stuart by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: How did I do that? Stuart looks behind him and sees Falcon back in the sky, gaining on him.

dialogues.text: thru 84

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: (to Martha) Say Mahmoudi Makmanachian.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Honey.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I know. It's a longshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowbell peeks out of the can. He sees Stuart flying towards him on an apparent collision course.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: No! Stuart! Turn! Turn! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stuart coming right at the paint can, turns at the last instant, just missing the can.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (relieved) Oh, that was close. At that instant, Falcon slams into the paint can, knockin it off the pole. Snowbell screams. The can falls a couple of stories to the pavement and rolls into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart, being pursued, flies past Falcon's treasure tower The plane hits one of the guidewires, causing the tower to tip over, spilling all of Falcon's treasures onto the roof. The tower is about to crush Margalo when she wakes up and jumps out of the way. Mrs. Little's ring rolls towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowbell is trying to get out of the can. He looks up and sees a cab speeding right at him. Snowbell screams.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I think it's on the next -- Stuart flies over the taxi.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Stuart! (to the driver) Stop! The driver smashes down on the brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAB SCREECHES to a halt inches from the paint can. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 88D CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Littles jump out of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I'm telling you I saw --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Snowbell1! George races to Snowbell and yanks him out of the can.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Snow, what were you doing in there?!

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (hysterically) Just hold me tight and don't let go!! Stuart flies by overhead.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That's my plane!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: But -- ? The Falcon flies by in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Come on! The Littles and Snowbell chase Stuart into the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Stuart's soccer team are getting ready to play

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: (exuberantly) Are the -- (quickly to one of kids) What are we called?

dialogues.speaker: IRWIN
dialogues.text: Thunderbolts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: (exuberantly) Are the Thunderbolts going to win today?! They all cheer.

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: ‘Cause we're the best!

dialogues.speaker: WALLACE
dialogues.text: And ‘cause we don't have Stuart. Wallace's friends snicker. Irwin looks up.

dialogues.speaker: IRWIN
dialogues.text: Hey. Isn't that Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: Where? Irwin points... Stuart's plane is headed straight for the soccer field. Falcon is in pursuit. There is a utility shed alongside the field. Stuart flying low seems to be headed straight for it. Just as he's about to hit him, a park attendant, carrying a rake, comes out of the shed. While the shed door is open, Stuart flies in and a moment later flies out a window on the opposite side of the shed.

dialogues.speaker: ALL KIDS
dialogues.text: (in unison) Whoa! Falcon heads for the shed. The park attendant doesn't see him. Calmly he shuts the door and Falcon cannot stop in time to avoid it. He slams into the door, hard.

dialogues.speaker: ALL KIDS
dialogues.text: (in unison) Yeah! Falcon, stunned, gathers himself, and takes off in pursuit. The Littles arrive in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart and Falcon are in a dogfight, dipping and darting, Falcon more the aggressor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Littles watch from below.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Stuart, look out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falcon gains on Stuart. He catches him. Falcon has the plane in his claws. He rips off the top set of wings and crushes them. This releases the plane from his grasp and the plane spirals downward. Stuart is paralyzed with fear. He tries grabbing for the flight manual but it flies out of the plane. The ground is spinning rapidly toward him. Terrified, he covers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE FAMILY
dialogues.text: as Stuart's plane approaches close enough for them to see that he is in it. While everyone stands there with their mouths open, it is Martha who yells.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Stuart! Suddenly, almost mystically, Stuart opens his eyes just i time to see his family in the crowd below. The vision of them standing there brings him to his senses and, just seconds before crashing, he pulls up on the controls and the plane shoots back up into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: She spoke. She said her first word. Stuart!

dialogues.speaker: SKY
dialogues.text: Stuart is PUTT-PUTTING along, trying to hold the PLANE steady. Falcon is soaring above searching for him. Suddenly, Margalo lands on the nose of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Leave, Stuart! Go! I'11l distract him while you get away.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart -- don't risk your life for me. I'm not worth it!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: You are to me! She's stunned. Then she smiles. They see Falcon. He sees them.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Littles are looking up, searching.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players are all looking up asking "Where's Stuart?" The Coach comes out on the field.

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: (exasperated) The game started! We're losing eight-nothing!

dialogues.speaker: OTHER TEAM
dialogues.text: is kicking the ball into an unguarded goal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart has finished telling Margalo his idea.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Stuart, that's crazy. In fact it's... suicide.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: We can do it! (then) Here he comes!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FALCON
dialogues.text: He heads for Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Coming right at Falcon. We don't see Margalo. 85. Falcon and Stuart head straight at each other faster and faster on a collision course. It seems suicidal -- a game of chicken.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: No, Stuart! Turn away! Run!

dialogues.speaker: IN AIR
dialogues.text: Just before impact, Stuart leaps out of the plane. The PLANE and FALCON collide with a CRASH and an EXPLOSION. Falcon is knocked for a loop, his feathers flying. tumbles, out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monte is on a ledge pawing through a garbage can.

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Can't I get a decent meal in this city? Falcon slams down into the garbage can featherless. looks up at Monte, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: MONTE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart is free-falling.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Catch him! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They all cup their hands.

dialogues.speaker: SKY
dialogues.text: Margalo swoops in, carrying Mrs. Little's ring in her little feet. Like a trapeze artist, Stuart grabs the ring. Margalo begins to struggle with Stuart's weight. They're dropping too quickly.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm too heavy. We're going to crash. For the first time in my life I'm too big!

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: I'm not letting you go, Stuart. If we go, we go together. Hang on! She tries hard to break their fall, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: The Littles scream encouragement and flap their arms like wings. Then they scream in fright.

dialogues.speaker: STUART'S FINGERS
dialogues.text: coming loose from the ring one-by-one. Finally, the last finger lets go and Stuart screams. REVEAL that Stuart has fallen from only a few feet off th ground. He keeps screaming, then realizes that he's on the ground, safe. His scream gradually changes into an embarrassed throat-clearing. The Littles rush to him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Stuart! Mrs. Little picks him up and kisses him over and over.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Stuart, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I think so. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: You almost gave me a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, too.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: For not realizing what an amazing extraordinary little guy you are. Stuart smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: And one more thing...

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (happy) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: If you ever sneak off again without telling me, and do something this dangerous, I will spank your little bottom until you are permanently cross-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Yes, Mom. She hugs him again.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (timidly) Mrs. Little. Here's your ring back... I stole it. Mrs. Little takes it back.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Margalo, you saved Stuart. We could have replaced the ring. The soccer kids come running over the hill towards the Littles. They're all excited.

dialogues.speaker: SOCCER KIDS
dialogues.text: Stu-art! Stu-art! Stu-art! Stu- art...!  92 93 94 95 88.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (excited) And in a couple of weeks comes Halloween -- we can go as each other -- then comes Thanksgiving, you can meet all the Littles -- then comes Christmas -- oh, that's the best! We'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A falling leaf floats down and lands between them. Margalo looks up. A flock of birds are migrating.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (less excited) I guess they're going south for the winter.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: (wistfully) Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Falcon never let you go did he?

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: No. Every year I'd just watch all the other birds go. The ones who were free.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: (painfully) -+. You're free.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: But... we'd be so far apart.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: .+. It wouldn't change a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all gathered. The sun is setting. Margalo is wearing her helmet and goggles ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Well... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She nods. 89. 95

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Are you sure you know where you're going? I can call the Triple-A and we can get you maps, discount coupons --

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Frederick.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: I'ma bird. Instinct should take over.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: I guess you've been waiting for this a long time.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: All my life. Only...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: Now it's not just talk. Now it's the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Are you scared?

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: The world's pretty big. And I'm pretty small.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: The way I see it, you're as big as you feel. Just spread your wings... and soar. Stuart and Margalo hug.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: I'll miss you, Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: I'll miss you, too. The hug ends.

dialogues.speaker: MARGALO
dialogues.text: I'll miss all of you... Little hi, Little low... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Little hey, Little ho. They all say good-bye. Then she turns, lowers her goggles and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (waves ) Bye, birdie. They watch her fly over the park. Stuart sniffles.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad...

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Yes, Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: .-. What's the silver lining this time?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LITTLE
dialogues.text: -+. She'll be back in the spring. Stuart smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: (annoyed) And how about me? I played no part on this? I was a whisker away from death! No concern, no appreciation... all I get to eat is what this kid drops on the floor. Well I've had enough! I'm packing up my tinkle ball and my poo-poo box, and I am out of here, Johnny! Hasta banana! You will never see me here again!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LITTLE
dialogues.text: Snow, would you like some tuna?

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBELL
dialogues.text: I love these people. FADE OUT.
